entry.def: A Romany is a member of a race of people who travel from place to place, usually living in caravans, rather than living in one place.
Romany means related or connected to the Romany people.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of a nomadic people originating in northern India and now living on all continents
2. the Indic language of the Gypsies
1. of or relating to the Gypsies or their language or culture;

auth_sentence.content: Slovakia also has a significant Romany population which suffers disproportionately high levels of poverty and social deprivation.

auth_sentence.content: Rooster Byron is a Romany squatter fighting the intention of the authorities to evict him from his mobile home in the forest.
